Mastering Text in Canva

Typography is crucial for effective design. It's not just what you say, but how you say it. This lesson explores Canva's text tools.

Adding and Editing Text

You can add text by selecting the 'Text' tab in the side panel and clicking 'Add a heading', 'Add a subheading', or 'Add a little bit of body text'. Alternatively, just press the 'T' key on your keyboard to add a text box. Once added, you can edit its content, font, size, color, alignment, and spacing (letter and line) from the top bar.

Font Pairing

Choosing fonts that work well together is key. A common rule is to pair a serif font (with small lines attached to characters, e.g., Times New Roman) with a sans-serif font (without lines, e.g., Arial). Canva's 'Styles' tab and 'Text' tab often suggest proven font combinations.

Text Effects

Canva offers powerful text effects. Select a text box and click 'Effects' in the top bar. Here you can find options like:

  • Shadow: Adds a drop shadow with customizable offset, direction, and color.
  • Lift: Adds a subtle, blurry shadow to make text pop.
  • Hollow/Splice: Creates an outline effect.
  • Curve: Bends your text into an arc, which you can adjust.

Creating a Text Hierarchy

Good design uses a clear hierarchy to guide the reader's eye. Use different sizes, weights (bold, regular), and styles for headings, subheadings, and body text to create a structure that is easy to read and understand.

questions.question: What is the keyboard shortcut to add a text box in Canva?
questions.explanation: Pressing the 'T' key is a quick shortcut to instantly add a new body text box to your canvas.

questions.question: Which text effect would you use to bend text into a circular shape?
questions.explanation: The 'Curve' effect allows you to wrap your text along an adjustable circular path.

questions.question: What is a common best practice for font pairing?
options: Using the same font for everything
Pairing a serif font with a sans-serif font
questions.correctAnswer: Pairing a serif font with a sans-serif font
questions.explanation: The contrast between a serif (for body text) and a sans-serif (for headlines), or vice-versa, is a classic and effective typography technique.

questions.question: Where do you find controls to change letter and line spacing?
options: In the 'Text' tab on the side panel
In the top bar after selecting a text box
questions.correctAnswer: In the top bar after selecting a text box
questions.explanation: The spacing controls (an icon with lines and arrows) are located in the top bar alongside font, size, and color options.

questions.question: What is the purpose of creating a text hierarchy?
options: To make the text look more uniform
To guide the reader's eye and improve readability
To use as many fonts as possible
To fit more text on the page
questions.correctAnswer: To guide the reader's eye and improve readability
questions.explanation: A clear hierarchy (headings, subheadings, body) tells the reader what is most important and how to navigate the information.

questions.question: The 'Lift' effect in Canva adds a...
questions.explanation: 'Lift' creates a soft shadow behind the text, making it appear slightly raised from the background.

questions.question: A font like Arial or Helvetica, which lacks small decorative lines, is called a:
questions.explanation: 'Sans' is French for 'without', so 'sans-serif' means 'without serifs' (the small lines).

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a standard text alignment option in Canva?
questions.explanation: Standard text alignment options are horizontal (left, center, right, justify). Vertical alignment is controlled by the text box's position.

questions.question: Canva's 'Styles' tab can help with typography by...
options: Adding new fonts to your library
questions.explanation: The 'Styles' tab offers pre-made pairings of fonts and colors that are designed to work well together.

questions.question: To add a simple text box, you can navigate to the side panel and click the ___ tab.
questions.explanation: The 'Text' tab is the primary place to find options for adding headings, subheadings, and body text.
